EmailTemplate.name: Pivotal IT Comm.Pivotal Wifi Announcement 11-6
EmailTemplate.subject: Expanding Pivotal Wi-Fi to more EMC offices
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi All,
We’re always looking for ways to improve how you connect to Pivotal networks. In partnership with the EMC Federated Services team, we’re expanding the coverage of Pivotal Wi-Fi services to more EMC shared offices. At the same time, EMC IT is updating Wi-Fi access points with the latest version of software to fix minor issues and keep them up-to-date.
The EMC IT team is updating Wi-Fi networks in EMC shared offices, starting at 9:00 am ET on Saturday, November 8th, 2014. The work should be completed by 5:00 pm ET.
- During the update window, you should expect intermittent Wi-Fi service interruptions at EMC shared offices, including the Pivotal Wi-Fi service. If you must work in an EMC shared office during this update window, we suggest you use a wired network connection and make sure you are setup with zScaler <https://sites.google.com/a/pivotal.io/pivotal-it/emc-systems/zscaler-proxy-setup> to get to all your Google Apps.
- When the work if finished, Pivots will have unrestricted access to Google Apps in even more shared EMC offices, just by connecting to Pivotal Wi-Fi <https://sites.google.com/a/pivotal.io/pivotal-it/emc-systems/pivotal-wifi>.
If you run into any issues or have any questions, please don't hesitate to email ask@pivotal.io <mailto:ask@pivotal.io> so we can give you a hand.
Thanks,
Brian Murray and Ryan Van Aken
